alert.note: Alert for Western Essex (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 7:09PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Essex and northeastern Middlesex Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 709 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Concord, or near Lexington, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rain with localized flooding, winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Little to no impact from hail is expected. Locations impacted include... Lynn, Lawrence, Haverhill, Waltham, Medford, Peabody, Methuen, Arlington, Salem, Billerica, Beverly, Woburn, Chelmsford, Andover, Lexington, Tewksbury, Gloucester, North Andover, Melrose and Saugus. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams.
